metadata.title: squid: denial of service in HTTP request parsing (important)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: Squid is a caching proxy for the Web. Due to an Uncontrolled Recursion bug in versions 2.6 through 2.7.STABLE9, versions 3.1 through 5.9, and versions 6.0.1 through 6.5, Squid may be vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack against HTTP Request parsing. This problem allows a remote client to perform Denial of Service attack by sending a large X-Forwarded-For header when the follow_x_forwarded_for feature is configured. This bug is fixed by Squid version 6.6. In addition, patches addressing this problem for the stable releases can be found in Squid's patch archives. 
            STATEMENT: All Squid configured without follow_x_forwarded_for are not vulnerable.
            MITIGATION: Remove all "follow_x_forwarded_for" lines from squid.conf

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
squid is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
